Package Controllers

Class Login

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controllers.Login
  • public class Login
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the login functions of the application

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField usernameField
      Requirement A1: Create a log-in form with the following capabilities: - Accepts a user ID and password and provides an appropriate error message - Determines the user's location (i.e., ZoneId) and displays it in a label on the log-in form - Displays the log-in form in English or French based on the user's computer language setting to translate all the text, labels, buttons, and errors - Automatically translates error control messages into English or French based on the user's comp language - (Unlisted) Only accepts the "test" user to login to the application - User: "test", Pass: "test", User_ID: 1

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        This initializes the screen and calls Data.generateLocalData() to generate the localization data, then Data.getRB() to pull the resource bundle for localization. This allows for the localization data to be used on other pages should I wish to extend this in the future. Finally, it uses the localization data to display the text on the screen.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is an issue

      • exitProgramButton

        private void exitProgramButton()
        This performs a simple exit of the program

      • loginButton

        private void loginButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This takes the values entered for username and password and first verifies that the username is 'test' per the instructions. If it's not, it throws an error. If it is, it then opens a database connection and searches for a user with a matching password. If the database finds it, the user is then directed to the main screen. If not, an error message pops up. For both successful and unsuccessful login attempts, accesslogger() is called and passed a boolean value based on the success.
        Parameters:
        event - This is the user action on the screen
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there's an issue

      • accessLogger

        private void accessLogger​(boolean success)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This handles writing to the access log file. It always records the ZonedTimeStamp of the access, the username attempted, and whether the attempt was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        success - This boolean is passed as true if the login attempt was successful, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - In case of issues.
